page.title: 08FARMING, HAILES
page.content: The farms in this area show great variety, ranging from wholly arable, through mixed stock and arable to wholly stock farming. The relief of the land varies from flat to hilly. Some of the flatland is high and exposed. Elsewhere it is low and sheltered. The high flat land is suitable for arable farming, the low land for arable and fruit. Sheep farming is mainly confined to the hilly land. Farms vary in size from 150 to 350 acres. Some farms are rented, others are owner-occupied. The crops grown include wheat, barley, beans, hay and triticale. Sheep provide the main form of livestock. There are also some pigs, poultry and beef cattle. There is no dairy farming.
